page.title: 05CUSTOMS EGMANTON/LAXTON
page.content:
The Egmanton-Maplebeck Trust. Originally four separate charities founded between 1616 and 1678- this trust is still providing an annual gift for the needy senior citizens of the villages Egmanton and Maplebeck some 8 miles distant. The land which provides the income is now rented by the Sports and Social Club. In January 1985 ten people were each given a bag of coal.
The Laxton Open Field System. This is the only working example of the medieval strip-farming system left in Britain. A detailed account of the system may be found on pages 6 and 15.
